bool pizSequenceHasMarkedNote ( PIZSequence *  x  ) 

Test if a note is marked in the sequence.

Parameters:
x A valid pointer.
Returns:
True if a note is marked, otherwise false.

Get MIDI data of the marked note.

Remarks:
The function return -1 in case of error.
Parameters:
x A valid pointer.
selector A selector to choose the MIDI data type to query as PIZSelector.
Returns:
The MIDI value.

void pizSequenceChangeMarkedNoteValue ( PIZSequence *  x,
PIZSelector  selector,
long  value 
)

Change MIDI data of the marked note.

Remarks:
Duration is increment (by grid's value) with positive argument (otherwise decrement).
Parameters:
x A valid pointer.
selector A selector to choose the MIDI data type to change as PIZSelector.
value The value to add.

Definition at line 427 of file pizSequence.c.

PIZError pizSequenceNotesToArray ( PIZSequence *  x,
PIZGrowingArray *  unselected,
PIZGrowingArray *  selected 
)

Get notes splitted in two dynamic arrays according to note's selected state.

Parameters:
x A valid pointer.
unselected A pointer to the dynamic array to fill with unselected notes.
selected A pointer to the dynamic array to fill with selected notes
Returns:
An error code. Notes are appended. The pointer can be NULL. Notes are transposed according to scale.
Remarks:
Examples : 
 err |= pizSequenceNotesToArray (sequence, ptrA, ptrB); 
 err |= pizSequenceNotesToArray (sequence, ptrA, NULL); 
 err |= pizSequenceNotesToArray (sequence, ptrA, ptrA);

Definition at line 440 of file pizSequence.c.

PIZError pizSequenceAddNotesWithArray ( PIZSequence *  x,
const PIZGrowingArray *  a,
long  flags 
)

Add notes with a dynamic array.

Parameters:
x A valid pointer.
a A pointer to the array.
flags The flags (as ORed PIZAddFlag).
Returns:
An error code.
Remarks:
An example : 
 long noteC[PIZ_DATA_NOTE_SIZE];
 long noteG[PIZ_DATA_NOTE_SIZE] = {24, 67, 90, 24, 1, 0, 0}; 

 noteC[PIZ_DATA_POSITION]     = 0;
 noteC[PIZ_DATA_PITCH]        = 60;
 noteC[PIZ_DATA_VELOCITY]     = 90;
 noteC[PIZ_DATA_DURATION]     = 24;
 noteC[PIZ_DATA_CHANNEL]      = 0;    // use sequence's global MIDI channel
 noteC[PIZ_DATA_IS_SELECTED]  = 0;
 noteC[PIZ_DATA_IS_MARKED]    = 0;

 for (i = 0; i < PIZ_DATA_NOTE_SIZE; i++) {
      pizGrowingArrayAppend (arrayPtr, noteC[i]);
 }

 for (i = 0; i < PIZ_DATA_NOTE_SIZE; i++) {
      pizGrowingArrayAppend (arrayPtr, noteG[i]);
 }

 pizSequenceAddNotesWithArray (sequencePtr, arrayPtr, PIZ_ADD_FLAG_SNAP | PIZ_ADD_FLAG_CLEAR);

Definition at line 733 of file pizSequence.c.

PIZError pizSequenceProceedStep ( PIZSequence *  x,
PIZGrowingArray *  a 
)

Fill an array with current index's notes and increment it.

Notes are appended. Return PIZ_ERROR if index is at end. Notes are transposed according to scale and velocity is modified by global velocity.

Parameters:
x A valid pointer.
a A pointer to a dynamic array.
Returns:
True if index is equal to zone's end otherwise false.
